recordTypes.name: Septic Pumping/Inspection  Report
recordTypes.description: Can only be completed by a Certified Pumper, POWTS Maintainer, POWTS Inspector, Master Plumber or Journeyman Plumber.

recordTypes.name: Electronic Notifications - Sign up or opt-out for Septic Maintenance reminders
recordTypes.description: Submit your email address here if you would like to receive annual septic maintenance reminders via e-mail.  Your email address will not be shared with any other parties.

recordTypes.name: NMM Annual Reclamation Renewal
recordTypes.description: Submit the annual renewal for the nonmetallic mine as required by Chapter 24 of the Sauk County Code of Ordinances and Wisconsin Administrative Code NR 135.

recordTypes.name: NMM Request Reclamation Inspection
recordTypes.description: Request either partial or complete reclamation. Please indicate if this is interim or permanent reclamation.

recordTypes.name: NMM Blast Report
recordTypes.description: This is for nonmetallic mine operators or their blasting company to report blasts in their nonmetallic mine operations if required by Sauk County as a condition of their special permits.

recordTypes.name: NMM Financial Assurance
recordTypes.description:
This is a location to provide updated financial assurance for a nonmetallic mine. 
A PDF of the updated financial assurance will need to be provided.

recordTypes.name: How are we doing?  Feedback survey for users to provide input on new OpenGov permitting platform.
recordTypes.description: Help us serve you better.  Provide constructive feedback to help us best serve you with permitting and records processes.

recordTypes.name: 1. Signing Up, Creating a Profile & Accessing Your Information
recordTypes.description: Instructions on signing up for an account and how to access your profile and records.

recordTypes.name: NMM Reclamation Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Submit a reclamation plan or modification to a reclamation plan for staff review based on Chapter 24 of the Sauk County Code of Ordinances and Wisconsin Administrative Code NR 135.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Code Enforcement
recordTypes.description: Use this form to report a concern or issue regarding zoning, shoreland, floodplain, or sanitation activities.

recordTypes.name: Conservation Code Enforcement
recordTypes.description: Use this form to report a concern or issue regarding conservation matters, such as inappropriate manure storage or handling.

recordTypes.name: 2. Applying for a Permit & Paying Fees
recordTypes.description: How to apply for a permit and pay any fees that are due.

recordTypes.name: 3. Receiving Your Permit or Other Document
recordTypes.description: How to view and print your issued permit, license, or other issued document.

recordTypes.name: Certified Survey Map Review
recordTypes.description: Submit a Certified Survey Map (CSM)

recordTypes.name: 4. Links to Helpful Documents
recordTypes.description: Links to Sauk County ordinances, town contacts, and other helpful information.

recordTypes.name: 5. How to Reach Us! Contact Information
Variance Application
recordTypes.description: A variance is a relaxation of a regulation within the zoning ordinance. Requests for variances are reviewed and decided by the Sauk County Board of Adjustment (BOA). The BOA is a quasi-judicial body that functions much like a court, applying rules and laws. It is the BOA's responsibility to ensure the ordinance provisions are not compromised for a property owner's personal convenience. The BOA applies legal criteria provided in state laws, court decisions, and local ordinance provisions to a specific situation. Variances are meant to be an infrequent remedy where an ordinance is found to impose a unique and substantial burden upon a property.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Use Permit and/or Rezone Application
recordTypes.description: Conditional Use Permit and/or Rezone

recordTypes.name: Professional Registration (Pumper, Inspector)
recordTypes.description: Use this application to complete pumper/inspector registration. All pumpers or septic inspectors reporting required septic system maintenance activity in Sauk County must be registered.

recordTypes.name: Manure Storage Closure Permit - A How-to Guide
Soil Test Filing Only
recordTypes.description: Soils test submission only, if ahead of, or separate from, the sanitary plans and permit application.

recordTypes.name: Camping
recordTypes.description: Camping permit required on properties where: Sauk County is the zoning authority, when no habitable dwelling exists on the property, and the zoning district is anything other than Single Family.

categories.name: Planning and Zoning
categories.content: If the applicant is anyone other than the property owner, an applicant accountability form will be required: Owner Accountability   (except for CSM's).
